body.name: AMD Ryzen™ 9 7950X3D 16-Core, 32-Thread Desktop Processor

features: The Socket AM5 socket allows processor to be placed on the PCB without soldering
Ryzen 9 product line processor for better reliability and ensure maximum productivity
Hexadeca-core (16 Core) processor core efficiently handles data to ensure quicker transfer of information with maximum usability
128 MB of L3 cache memory provides excellent hit rate in short access time enabling improved system performance
Processor with 4.20 GHz clock speed for quick and dependable processing of data to ensure maximum productivity
Comes with AMD Radeon Graphics controller for amazing graphics output
body.description: The Ultimate Processor for Gaming, with AMD 3D V-Cache™ Technology for Even More Game Performance1

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.7 4.7 out of 5 stars 418 ratings 4.7 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fastest gaming CPU on the planet
reviews.reviewText: fastest gaming CPU - that is Tom's Hardware's opinion: and so far it has lived up to that for me. I got this on sale for only $10 more than the 7900 and it was very much worth it! AMD has managed to make this thing deliver at a remarkably low 95W TDP as well - quite remarkable. Happily your socket AM4 cooler with fit on your new motherboard, although in my case it required a trip to the hardware store to buy 4 metric bolts (the backplate is now integral, and for some coolers, like my TT waterblock, you have to screw into the backplate directly).Did you pick up on the "new motherboard" comment? You're going to need one - AMD has moved to LGA rather than PGA for their new chips and socket AM5, and they only support DDR5 as well, so you're going to need some new RAM - BUT if you don't cheap out, buy a high-end board and EXPO certified RAM and get ready to launch moon rockets, or anything else your heart desires, with a very very fast system.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid choice for the next few chips!
reviews.reviewText: The AMD Ryzen 9 7000 7950X3D is a testament to the relentless innovation from AMD. Leveraging the cutting-edge 3D V-cache technology, this processor offers performance levels previously unseen in the consumer CPU market.From a sheer computational perspective, it effortlessly handles intense multi-threaded applications and provides remarkable gaming performance. The added cache delivers a palpable improvement in latency-sensitive tasks, ensuring that users get a snappier and more responsive computing experience.The thermals and power efficiency, aided by the refined architecture, mean that not only is this chip fast, but it also runs cooler and more efficiently than its predecessors. This leads to quieter PC operations, even under load.In the realm of content creation, gaming, and general multitasking, the 7950X3D stands out as a behemoth. The seamless integration with the AM4 platform is a boon for those looking to upgrade without overhauling their entire system.To conclude, the AMD Ryzen 9 7000 7950X3D is a game-changer. It underscores AMD's commitment to pushing the boundaries of what's possible in consumer-grade processors. If you're in the market for uncompromised performance, this CPU is a stellar choice. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy install. Went from 120-140 FPS to 200-240 FPS. I noticed big difference in response time 😎

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid 1% lows while being rock solid stable!
reviews.reviewText: Running this chip with a DeepCool LT720 360mm rad with an ElecGear Carbon fiber contact frame with kingpin KPX thermal compound. In a lighter gaming workload, I didn't see temps get above 55C on the hottest sensor from hwinfo in the recommended config from AMD. I don't think high temperatures will be a problem for this particular chip, at least not outside what the rest of the 7000 series family can hit.I personally haven't had any stability concerns with this processor in the 3 weeks that I have ran it in place of my 7700x, even with EXPO enabled. In terms of average framerate, this chip feels like a 7700x subjectively, as I have no issues getting frames to a 4090 that I can tell. The 3d cache helps with 1%/.1% lows, to the point that the majority of the micro stutters I had gotten from my 7700x are largely gone in gameplay. There may be a small stutter when swapping from a game to a non game on another screen if using AMD's recommended config, but not enough to be a bother.Overall, if you want to mess around with extra cores later on (streaming, encode, etc.) but want the 3dcache for games now AND your budget allows for it, the 7950X3D is a pretty solid pick in my book for the enthusiast who wants the best without heading into server CPU territory.PC specs relevant to review:Asus ROG Crosshair x670E Extreme (with ElecGear contact frame, BIOS 1415)Gskill Trident Z5 Neo 32gb ddr5 6000 CL30 (EXPO)DeepCool Lt720 360mm radiatior (stock fans with unit, KPX compound)Gigabyte RTX 4090 gaming OC

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This thing is a powerhouse of a processor. Paired it with a PowerColor RX 7900xtx and well, they’re absolutely made for each other. No compatibility issues, and it just flows so well and surprisingly doesn’t run that hot without liquid cooling.

reviews.reviewerName: Works great and had all the installation gear like advertised.
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy install and great speeds. Disappointed I've asked 2 times for my free copy of avatar but never received the email.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the dollars
reviews.reviewText: (bought 8 mos ago via Amazon) I'm a hardware/software guy, and I've been building my own rigs since 1996. For CPUs, my price point tends to be ~$630 or so (in the day, that got me a p2 400mhz). This is A LOT of cpu for the money. This thing will chew through a database, photoshoop AI process, an unzipping of huge files, and MS flightsim and Cyberpunk with ease and efficiency (have you checked the low wattage on this thing?). I do recommend an extended board, notated by the "E" at the end of the name. The MSI board is my only regret. Get a premium board to match this premium cpu.I am doing overkill w/ the Corsair 420 AIO, but I've read other reviews that say this thing can be air-cooled. YMMV.Good luck with your builds my guys. Have fun and happy new year!

At first I was skeptical on the performance of the 7950x3d from what I've elsewhere in games, but paired with process lasso I have yet to see any issues. Boot times are said to be 5~10 minutes long, not once have I ran into that. Boots in less than a minute. Perfect cpu for both gaming and work.

Bis jetzt die beste CPU für mich, die wirklich alles kann und endlich keine 90 Grad auf der AIO Anzeige.Arbeiten,Zocken At his Best, aber der Preis ist etwas zu teuer, wie gefühlt alle Sachen dieser Welt.
Un procesador de alta gama con mucha potencia, si fuera más barato sería perfecto.
Nulla da dire, consegna puntuale e prodotto ottimo
Dit product doet gewoon wat het moet doen. Lekker snel.
